medical_history.history_of_present_illness: At the age of seven years five months, the patient was admitted with a two-week history of left frontal headaches, followed by progressive swelling of the face and neck, and a non-productive cough. Cervical veins became distended and tender a few days before admission, with twisted superficial veins over the thorax.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient had a history of embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma diagnosed at age three years five months, treated with chemotherapy and surgical resection.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandmother had 'liver cancer'; maternal aunt had breast cancer, another had cervical cancer, and a maternal uncle had bladder cancer. Paternal grandfather had colon cancer, and a paternal uncle had bladder cancer.
